meanings.definition: A person or animal that climbs with difficulty and effort.
meanings.sent1: The little clamberers struggled to reach the top of the tree.
meanings.sent2: The mountain was filled with clamberers attempting the steep ascent.
meanings.sent3: The clamberers in the zoo made the visitors chuckle with their clumsy attempts to climb.
meanings.sent4: The clamberers in the race were like determined ants scaling a giant hill.
meanings.sent5: The image of the clamberers clinging to the rock face was etched in his memory.

meanings.definition: Those who climb awkwardly or with difficulty.
meanings.sent1: The group of clamberers struggled to make their way up the rocky slope.
meanings.sent2: The forest was alive with the sounds of clamberers trying to navigate the dense undergrowth.
meanings.sent3: The clamberers at the gym always made everyone smile with their ungraceful attempts at climbing.
meanings.sent4: The clamberers in the competition moved like determined snails inching their way up the wall.
meanings.sent5: The sight of the clamberers clinging to the ladder was both amusing and endearing.
